articles.title: Coronavirus LIVE: India Sees Over 2,500 New COVID-19 Cases In 24 Hours
articles.description: India on Thursday recorded at least 2,628 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total tally of coronavirus cases to 4,31,44,820, while the active cases increased to 15,414, according to the Union Health Ministry.
articles.content:

articles.title: Wife, Lover Arrested For Killing Husband In Delhi: Police
articles.description: A 40-year-old woman was arrested along with her "lover" and another man allegedly for killing her husband in central Delhi's Daryaganj area, police said on Thursday.
articles.content:
Police said that woman was not happy with her husband and wanted to marry someone else.(Representational)

articles.title: Assam Floods: Death Count Reaches 30, Over 5.61 Lakh People Affected
articles.description: The flood situation in Assam remained critical on Thursday with two more persons, including a child, losing their lives and over 5.61 lakh people still suffering in the deluge across seven districts, as per an official bulletin.

articles.title: At UN, China, Russia Block US Bid To Sanction North Korea Over Missile
articles.description: China and Russia vetoed on Thursday a U.S.-led push to impose more UN sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches, publicly splitting the U.N. Security Council for the first time since it started punishing Pyongyang in 2006.
articles.content:
The UN vote to sanction against North Korea came after Pyongyang fired 3 back-back-missile on Wednesday.

articles.title: Russia Ready To Help Overcome Global Food Crisis If...: Putin

articles.title: Spain Passes Bill Qualifying All Non-Consensual Sex As Rape
articles.description: Spain's lower house of parliament on Thursday passed a bill that qualifies all non-consensual sex as rape in response to social outrage after the so-called Wolf Pack case gave momentum to the women's rights movement in the country four years ago.
articles.content:

articles.title: Import Of Paper To Be Brought Under Compulsory Registration From Oct 2022
articles.description: The import policy of major paper products has been amended from 'free' to 'free subject to compulsory registration under Paper Import Monitoring System', the Union Ministry of Commerce & Industry said on Thursday.
